peddle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to sell goods to people, especially goods that people disapprove of because they are illegal, harmful, or of not very high quality
peddle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They were accused of peddling drugs.
people who peddle cigarettes to young children
peddle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to try to sell things to people, especially by going from place to place
peddle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Farmers come to Seoul to peddle rice.
a door-to-door salesman peddling his wares  (=selling his goods)
peddle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to try to persuade people to accept an opinion or idea which is wrong or false
peddle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: politicians peddling instant solutions to long-standing problems
peddle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to sell, or try to sell, goods to people, especially by going from place to place or by selling them in the street
peddle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: a door-to-door salesman peddling his wares
Farmers come to Seoul to peddle rice.
